vehicles.description: A red flatbed truck carrying construction materials is parked on the right side of the road under the bridge, partially occupying the driving lane.
vehicles.explanation: The truck's positioning narrows the available space on the road for the ego vehicle to maneuver.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Two construction workers are present, one is standing on the road directly behind the aforementioned truck and another is close to the side barriers. Both workers are wearing high-visibility jackets.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of workers on the road indicates potential road work ahead and the need for the ego vehicle to slow down to ensure their safety.

traffic cones.description: Multiple orange traffic cones are placed in a line extending from the back of the truck towards the center of the road, guiding traffic away from the construction area.
traffic cones.explanation: The cones are directing the traffic to move away from the area occupied by the construction workers and the truck, indicating a merge or shift in the traffic pattern.

barriers.description: Yellow portable barriers are placed on the right side of the road, separating the construction area from the traffic lane.
barriers.explanation: The barriers define the construction zone and inform the drivers that part of the road may be inaccessible.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the observed traffic scene, various road users are interacting in a construction area. A conspicuous red flatbed truck, carrying building materials, is parked on the right side of the road under a bridge. Unfortunately, part of this truck extends into the driving lane, reducing the road width available for other vehicles to navigate safely. This positioning necessitates cautious maneuvering from the ego vehicle to avoid any potential accidents.

Adjacent to the truck, two construction workers can be spotted. Both workers are adorned with high-visibility jackets for safety. One worker stands closely behind the parked truck on the road, while the other is near the side barriers. Their presence not only indicates ongoing road work but also underscores the need for the ego vehicle to decelerate, ensuring these workers' safety amidst the traffic.

To guide vehicles away from this area, multiple orange traffic cones are strategically placed starting from the back of the truck extending toward the center of the road. These cones signal a change in the traffic flow, effectively directing it away from the occupied area by the construction workers and truck. This setup requires drivers to possibly merge or shift their lanes, adapting to the modified traffic patterns.

Further ensuring safety, yellow portable barriers are positioned along the right side of the road. These barriers act as a clear demarcation of the construction zone, informing drivers about the part of the road that might be off-limits due to the ongoing construction activities. This visual boundary aids in preventing vehicles from inadvertently entering the work zone, enhancing both worker and traffic safety.

Overall, the setup in this construction area, highlighted by the parked truck, workers, traffic cones, and barriers, shapes the driving behaviors necessary to maintain safety and efficiency in navigating through or around the temporary modifications in the road environment.

1.description and explanation: A safety cone, also known as a traffic cone, is a cone-shaped marker that is typically placed on roads or footpaths to temporarily redirect traffic in a safe manner. They are usually colored in bright fluorescent hues like orange or yellow to be highly visible. This cone indicates that there might be road work ahead, an obstacle on the road or that part of the lane is closed for some reason. The driver should be prepared to slow down and move over to avoid the cone while staying alert for any potential hazards or changes in traffic patterns.

driving_suggestion: The ego vehicle should reduce speed immediately and prepare to change lanes if necessary, while maintaining a safe distance from the construction workers and the parked truck. It should also watch for any additional signs or signals from the workers indicating further instructions.
